org.mym.plog.printer

Class FilePrinter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mym.plog.AbsPrinter
      • org.mym.plog.printer.FilePrinter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Interceptor, Printer

    public class FilePrinter
extends AbsPrinter
implements Closeable
    Print logs into a file. Soft wrap is disabled by default.
    Since:
    2.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  FilePrinter.FileNameGenerator
      The interface to generate new log file.
      static class  FilePrinter.TimingFileNameGenerator

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static String DIR_EXT_FILES
      Place holder string for the external files dir.
      protected static String DIR_EXT_ROOT
      Place holder string for the external storage root dir.(requires WRITE PERMISSION)
      protected static String DIR_INT_FILES
      Place holder string for the internal files dir.

    • Field Detail

      • DIR_INT_FILES

        protected static final String DIR_INT_FILES
        Place holder string for the internal files dir.
        See Also:
        Context.getFilesDir(), Constant Field Values

      • DIR_EXT_FILES

        protected static final String DIR_EXT_FILES
        Place holder string for the external files dir. (requires no permission)
        See Also:
        Context.getExternalFilesDir(String), Constant Field Values

      • DIR_EXT_ROOT

        protected static final String DIR_EXT_ROOT
        Place holder string for the external storage root dir.(requires WRITE PERMISSION)
        See Also:
        Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory(), Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • FilePrinter

        public FilePrinter(@NonNull
                   Context context)
            throws IllegalStateException
        Create a file printer using default path (external files dir).
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If try to use external storage but external storage is unavailable.

      • FilePrinter

        public FilePrinter(@NonNull
                   Context context,
                   @NonNull
                   String logFilePath)
            throws IllegalStateException
        Create a file printer using specified path.
        Parameters:
        logFilePath - absolute path; may use predefined placeholders in start. Currently supported placeholders: DIR_INT_FILES, DIR_EXT_FILES, DIR_EXT_ROOT.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If try to use external storage but external storage is unavailable.

      • FilePrinter

        public FilePrinter(@NonNull
                   Context context,
                   @NonNull
                   String filePath,
                   @NonNull
                   FilePrinter.FileNameGenerator generator,
                   long fileSizeLimit)
            throws IllegalStateException
        Create a file printer.
        Parameters:
        fileSizeLimit - file size limit. By default a single log file would not over 1M. If a non-positive integer is provided, log files has no size limit.
        generator - a generator to provide filename when creating new log file.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException

    • Method Detail

      • print

        public void print(int level,
                  @NonNull
                  String tag,
                  @NonNull
                  String msg)
        Description copied from interface: Printer
        Do the real output operation, e.g. call Log.x(), or write to file.
        Specified by:
        print in interface Printer
        Parameters:
        level - print level of this log.
        msg - content of this log(already formatted and soft wrapped, if needed).

      • printFileHeader

        protected void printFileHeader(PrintStreamPrinter printer)
        This method provides a quick method to provide file header, e.g. crash files. Although you still need to extends this class, but you needn't copy whole file management code.

      • createPrintText

        protected String createPrintText(int level,
                                 String tag,
                                 String msg)
        Override this method to redefine your preferred output format. By default the log format is similar as shown in logcat.
        Parameters:
        level - log level
        tag - log tag
        msg - log content
        Returns:
        the text to be written to file

      • getLogFilePath

        public final String getLogFilePath()
        Get the absolute path for log files. The proposal of this method is to debug or traverse log path, not setting it.

        Override this method is not really recommended; consider using constructor instead.

        Returns:
        the absolute path for log files; should not be null

      • close

        public void close()
        Close associated files, etc.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
